intro: Allantodia crinipes, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in salty, humid environments and is often found growing along beaches and dunes. Its fibrous roots help stabilize coastal soils, making it an important species in coastal ecosystems. Allantodia crinipes is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
